conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F.
Object A is positioned above objects C and D.
Object B is positioned above objects E and F.
When A is set down where C and D already stand, A will collide with them.
A will rest against or on top of C and D depending on the exact placement.
B will collide with E and F and end up at rest in contact with them.
No further motion occurs once all the blocks are touching and supported by the tabletop.
Gravity keeps the objects pressed together and against the surface.
The internal step-by-step reasoning involves straightforward application of basic mechanics.
